density

Class Params

  • java.lang.Object
    • density.Parameters
      • density.ParamsPre
        • density.Params

  • public class Params
extends ParamsPre
    Params is the main class for querying and adjusting parameters for MaxEnt.

    Each parameter can be queried or set with its own typesafe methods. More general non-typesafe methods for setting one or more parameters are available in the parent class.

    Typical usage to set up some parameters and make a Maxent model is:

    • Params params = new Params();
    • ... set some parameters using the methods in this package
    • params.setSelections();
    • Runner runner = new Runner(params);
    • runner.start();
    • runner.end();

    The params.setSelections() method is needed only if one or more of the toggle parameters have been used (toggle species selected, toggle layer type, toggle layer selected).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Params() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAdjustsampleradius()
      Get value of adjustsampleradius parameter: Add this number of pixels to the radius of white/purple dots for samples on pictures of predictions.
      Negative values reduce size of dots.
      java.lang.String getApplythresholdrule()
      Get value of applythresholdrule parameter: Apply a threshold rule, generating a binary output grid in addition to the regular prediction grid.
      double getBeta_categorical()
      Get value of beta_categorical parameter: Regularization parameter to be applied to all categorical features; negative value enables automatic setting
      double getBeta_hinge()
      Get value of beta_hinge parameter: Regularization parameter to be applied to all hinge features; negative value enables automatic setting
      double getBeta_lqp()
      Get value of beta_lqp parameter: Regularization parameter to be applied to all linear, quadratic and product features; negative value enables automatic setting
      double getBeta_threshold()
      Get value of beta_threshold parameter: Regularization parameter to be applied to all threshold features; negative value enables automatic setting
      double getBetamultiplier()
      Get value of betamultiplier parameter: Multiply all automatic regularization parameters by this number.
      java.lang.String getBiasfile()
      Get value of biasfile parameter: Sampling is assumed to be biased according to the sampling distribution given in this grid file.
      Values in this file must not be zero or negative.
      int getBiastype()
      Get value of biastype parameter: Type of bias correction procedure to be used, if bias file is given
      double getConvergencethreshold()
      Get value of convergencethreshold parameter: Stop training when the drop in log loss per iteration drops below this number
      java.lang.String getDebiasaverages()
      Get value of debiasaverages parameter:
      double getDefaultprevalence()
      Get value of defaultprevalence parameter: Default prevalence of the species: probability of presence at ordinary occurrence points.
      See Elith et al., Diversity and Distributions, 2011 for details.
      java.lang.String getEnvironmentallayers()
      Get value of environmentallayers parameter: Environmental variables can be in a directory containing one file per variable,
      or all together in a .csv file in SWD format.
      java.lang.String getFactorbiasout()
      Get value of factorbiasout parameter:
      int getHingethreshold()
      Get value of hingethreshold parameter: Number of samples at which hinge features start being used
      int getL2lqthreshold()
      Get value of l2lqthreshold parameter: Number of samples at which quadratic features start being used
      java.lang.String getLogfile()
      Get value of logfile parameter: File name to be used for writing debugging information about a run in output directory
      int getLq2lqptthreshold()
      Get value of lq2lqptthreshold parameter: Number of samples at which product and threshold features start being used
      int getMaximumbackground()
      Get value of maximumbackground parameter: If the number of background points / grid cells is larger than this number, then this number of cells is chosen randomly for background points
      int getMaximumiterations()
      Get value of maximumiterations parameter: Stop training after this many iterations of the optimization algorithm
      int getNodata()
      Get value of nodata parameter: Value to be interpreted as nodata values in SWD sample data
      java.lang.String getOutputdirectory()
      Get value of outputdirectory parameter: Directory where outputs will be written.
      java.lang.String getOutputfiletype()
      Get value of outputfiletype parameter: File format used for writing output grids
      java.lang.String getOutputformat()
      Get value of outputformat parameter: Representation of probabilities used in writing output grids.
      int getParallelupdatefrequency()
      Get value of parallelupdatefrequency parameter:
      java.lang.String[] getParameters()
      Get a list of all Maxent parameters
      java.lang.String getPriordistribution()
      Get value of priordistribution parameter:
      java.lang.String getProjectionlayers()
      Get value of projectionlayers parameter: Location of an alternate set of environmental variables.
      int getRandomtestpoints()
      Get value of randomtestpoints parameter: Percentage of presence localities to be randomly set aside as test points, used to compute AUC, omission etc.
      int getReplicates()
      Get value of replicates parameter: Number of replicate runs to do when cross-validating, bootstrapping or doing sampling with replacement runs
      java.lang.String getReplicatetype()
      Get value of replicatetype parameter: If replicates is greater than 1, do multiple runs of this type:
      Crossvalidate: samples divided into replicates folds; each fold in turn used for test data.
      Bootstrap: replicate sample sets chosen by sampling with replacement.
      Subsample: replicate sample sets chosen by removing random test percentage without replacement to be used for evaluation.
      java.lang.String getSamplesfile()
      Get value of samplesfile parameter: Please enter the name of a file containing presence locations for one or more species.
      java.lang.String getScientificpattern()
      Get value of scientificpattern parameter: Pattern used to write scientific notation in output grids
      java.lang.String getTestsamplesfile()
      Get value of testsamplesfile parameter: Use the presence localities in this file to compute statistics (AUC, omission etc.)
      The file can contain different localities for different species.
      It takes precedence over the random test percentage.
      int getThreads()
      Get value of threads parameter: Number of processor threads to use.
      java.lang.String getType(java.lang.String param)
      Get the type of a parameter, or null if the parameter doesn't exist
      boolean isAddallsamplestobackground()
      Get value of addallsamplestobackground parameter: Add all samples to the background, even if they have combinations of environmental values that are already present in the background
      boolean isAddsamplestobackground()
      Get value of addsamplestobackground parameter: Add to the background any sample for which has a combination of environmental values that isn't already present in the background
      boolean isAllowpartialdata()
      Get value of allowpartialdata parameter: During model training, allow use of samples that have nodata values for one or more environmental variables.
      boolean isAppendtoresultsfile()
      Get value of appendtoresultsfile parameter: If false, maxentResults.csv file is reinitialized before each run
      boolean isAskoverwrite()
      Get value of askoverwrite parameter: If output files already exist for a species being modeled,
      pop up a window asking whether to overwrite or skip.
      boolean isAutofeature()
      Get value of autofeature parameter: Automatically select which feature classes to use, based on number of training samples
      boolean isAutorun()
      Get value of autorun parameter: Start running as soon as the the program starts up
      boolean isBiasisbayesianprior()
      Get value of biasisbayesianprior parameter: Bias file is really a Bayesian prior
      boolean isCache()
      Get value of cache parameter: Make a .mxe cached version of ascii files, for faster access
      boolean isCachefeatures()
      Get value of cachefeatures parameter: Cache derived features (such as product features) in memory to speed up training
      boolean isDoclamp()
      Get value of doclamp parameter: Apply clamping when projecting
      boolean isDosqrtcat()
      Get value of dosqrtcat parameter:
      boolean isExtrapolate()
      Get value of extrapolate parameter: Predict to regions of environmental space outside the limits encountered during training
      boolean isFadebyclamping()
      Get value of fadebyclamping parameter: Reduce prediction at each point in projections by the difference between
      clamped and non-clamped output at that point
      boolean isGivemaxaucestimate()
      Get value of givemaxaucestimate parameter: Write an estimate of the maximum achievable AUC in the html output, based on the extent of the Maxent distribution
      boolean isHinge()
      Get value of hinge parameter: Allow hinge features to be used
      boolean isJackknife()
      Get value of jackknife parameter: Measure importance of each environmental variable by training with each environmental variable first omitted, then used in isolation
      boolean isLinear()
      Get value of linear parameter: Allow linear features to be used
      boolean isLogscale()
      Get value of logscale parameter: If selected, all pictures of models will use a logarithmic scale for color-coding.
      boolean isManualreplicates()
      Get value of manualreplicates parameter: If true, species data has already been split into replicated runs in input.
      boolean isMinclamping()
      Get value of minclamping parameter: If true, do clamping only at sites where it results in lower prediction.
      boolean isNceas()
      Get value of nceas parameter:
      boolean isOutputgrids()
      Get value of outputgrids parameter: Write output grids.
      boolean isPerspeciesresults()
      Get value of perspeciesresults parameter: Write separate maxentResults file for each species
      boolean isPictures()
      Get value of pictures parameter: Create a .png image for each output grid
      boolean isPlots()
      Get value of plots parameter: Write various plots for inclusion in .html output
      boolean isPolyhedral()
      Get value of polyhedral parameter:
      boolean isPrefixes()
      Get value of prefixes parameter: When toggling samples or layers selected or layer types, allow toggle string to be a prefix rather than an exact match.
      boolean isPrintversion()
      Get value of printversion parameter: Print Maxent software version number and exit
      boolean isProduct()
      Get value of product parameter: Allow product features to be used
      boolean isQuadratic()
      Get value of quadratic parameter: Allow quadratic features to be used
      boolean isRandomseed()
      Get value of randomseed parameter: If selected, a different random seed will be used for each run, so a different random test/train partition
      will be made and a different random subset of the background will be used, if applicable.
      boolean isRemoveduplicates()
      Get value of removeduplicates parameter: Remove duplicate presence records.
      If environmental data are in grids, duplicates are records in the same grid cell.
      Otherwise, duplicates are records with identical coordinates.
      boolean isResponsecurves()
      Get value of responsecurves parameter: Create graphs showing how predicted relative probability of occurrence depends on the value of each environmental variable
      boolean isResponsecurvesexponent()
      Get value of responsecurvesexponent parameter: Instead of showing the logistic value for the y axis in response curves, show the exponent (a linear combination of features)
      boolean isSkipifexists()
      Get value of skipifexists parameter: If output files already exist for a species being modeled,
      skip the species without remaking the model.
      boolean isThreshold()
      Get value of threshold parameter: Allow threshold features to be used
      boolean isTooltips()
      Get value of tooltips parameter: Show messages that explain various parts of the interface, like this message
      boolean isVerbose()
      Get value of verbose parameter: Gived detailed diagnostics for debugging
      boolean isVisible()
      Get value of visible parameter: Make the Maxent user interface visible
      boolean isWarnings()
      Get value of warnings parameter: Pop up windows to warn about potential problems with input data.
      Regardless of this setting, warnings are always printed to the log file.
      boolean isWritebackgroundpredictions()
      Get value of writebackgroundpredictions parameter: Write .csv file with predictions at background points
      boolean isWriteclampgrid()
      Get value of writeclampgrid parameter: Write a grid that shows the spatial distribution of clamping.
      At each point, the value is the absolute difference between prediction values with and without clamping.
      boolean isWritemess()
      Get value of writemess parameter: A multidimensional environmental similarity surface (MESS) shows where novel climate conditions exist in the projection layers.
      The analysis shows both the degree of novelness and the variable that is most out of range at each point.
      boolean isWriteplotdata()
      Get value of writeplotdata parameter: Write output files containing the data used to make response curves, for import into external plotting software

      • setProjectionlayers

        public void setProjectionlayers(java.lang.String value)
        Set value of projectionlayers parameter: Location of an alternate set of environmental variables. Maxent models will be projected onto these variables.
        Can be a .csv file (in SWD format) or a directory containing one file per variable.
        Multiple projection files/directories can be separated by commas.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value

        Multiple projection files/directories can be separated by commas.

        Get value of warnings parameter: Pop up windows to warn about potential problems with input data.
        Regardless of this setting, warnings are always printed to the log file.
        Returns:
        The value warnings parameter

      • setRemoveduplicates

        public void setRemoveduplicates(boolean value)
        Set value of removeduplicates parameter: Remove duplicate presence records.
        If environmental data are in grids, duplicates are records in the same grid cell.
        Otherwise, duplicates are records with identical coordinates.

        Default value is true.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • isRemoveduplicates

        public boolean isRemoveduplicates()
        Get value of removeduplicates parameter: Remove duplicate presence records.
        If environmental data are in grids, duplicates are records in the same grid cell.
        Otherwise, duplicates are records with identical coordinates.
        Returns:
        The value removeduplicates parameter

      • setWriteclampgrid

        public void setWriteclampgrid(boolean value)
        Set value of writeclampgrid parameter: Write a grid that shows the spatial distribution of clamping.
        At each point, the value is the absolute difference between prediction values with and without clamping.

        Default value is true.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • isWriteclampgrid

        Get value of writeclampgrid parameter: Write a grid that shows the spatial distribution of clamping.

      • setWritemess

        public void setWritemess(boolean value)
        Set value of writemess parameter: A multidimensional environmental similarity surface (MESS) shows where novel climate conditions exist in the projection layers.
        The analysis shows both the degree of novelness and the variable that is most out of range at each point.

        Default value is true.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • setBetamultiplier

        public void setBetamultiplier(double value)
        Set value of betamultiplier parameter: Multiply all automatic regularization parameters by this number. A higher number gives a more spread-out distribution.

        Default value is 1.0.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • setMaximumbackground

        public void setMaximumbackground(int value)
        Set value of maximumbackground parameter: If the number of background points / grid cells is larger than this number, then this number of cells is chosen randomly for background points

        Default value is 10000.

        value - the new value

      • setBiasfile

        public void setBiasfile(java.lang.String value)
        Set value of biasfile parameter: Sampling is assumed to be biased according to the sampling distribution given in this grid file.
        Values in this file must not be zero or negative. MaxEnt will factor out the bias.
        Requires environmental data to be in grids, rather than a SWD format file
        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • getBiasfile

        public java.lang.String getBiasfile()
        Get value of biasfile parameter: Sampling is assumed to be biased according to the sampling distribution given in this grid file.
        Values in this file must not be zero or negative. MaxEnt will factor out the bias.
        Requires environmental data to be in grids, rather than a SWD format file
        Returns:
        The value biasfile parameter

      • setTestsamplesfile

        public void setTestsamplesfile(java.lang.String value)
        Set value of testsamplesfile parameter: Use the presence localities in this file to compute statistics (AUC, omission etc.)
        The file can contain different localities for different species.
        It takes precedence over the random test percentage.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • getTestsamplesfile

        public java.lang.String getTestsamplesfile()
        Get value of testsamplesfile parameter: Use the presence localities in this file to compute statistics (AUC, omission etc.)
        The file can contain different localities for different species.
        It takes precedence over the random test percentage.
        Returns:
        The value testsamplesfile parameter

      • setReplicates

        public void setReplicates(int value)
        Set value of replicates parameter: Number of replicate runs to do when cross-validating, bootstrapping or doing sampling with replacement runs

        Default value is 1.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • getReplicates

        public int getReplicates()
        Get value of replicates parameter: Number of replicate runs to do when cross-validating, bootstrapping or doing sampling with replacement runs
        Returns:
        The value replicates parameter

      • setReplicatetype

        public void setReplicatetype(java.lang.String value)
        Set value of replicatetype parameter: If replicates is greater than 1, do multiple runs of this type:
        Crossvalidate: samples divided into replicates folds; each fold in turn used for test data.
        Bootstrap: replicate sample sets chosen by sampling with replacement.
        Subsample: replicate sample sets chosen by removing random test percentage without replacement to be used for evaluation.

        Default value is crossvalidate.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • getReplicatetype

        public java.lang.String getReplicatetype()
        Get value of replicatetype parameter: If replicates is greater than 1, do multiple runs of this type:
        Crossvalidate: samples divided into replicates folds; each fold in turn used for test data.
        Bootstrap: replicate sample sets chosen by sampling with replacement.
        Subsample: replicate sample sets chosen by removing random test percentage without replacement to be used for evaluation.
        Returns:
        The value replicatetype parameter

      • setNodata

        public void setNodata(int value)
        Set value of nodata parameter: Value to be interpreted as nodata values in SWD sample data

        Default value is -9999.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • getNodata

        public int getNodata()
        Get value of nodata parameter: Value to be interpreted as nodata values in SWD sample data
        Returns:
        The value nodata parameter

      • isMinclamping

        public boolean isMinclamping()
        Get value of minclamping parameter: If true, do clamping only at sites where it results in lower prediction.
        Returns:
        The value minclamping parameter

      • isManualreplicates

        public boolean isManualreplicates()
        Get value of manualreplicates parameter: If true, species data has already been split into replicated runs in input.
        Returns:
        The value manualreplicates parameter
